result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved.

Defendant Maurice S Talley appeared by phone.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Maurice S Talley.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Information will mirror complaint. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Letter to Judge Koss requesting appearance via telephone

10/14/22 Court's response: okay, granted. PAK

records.addlTxt: Bond set 6-14-2022

Defendant Maurice S Talley in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant quashed, bond reinstated. Defendant has MFAC paperwork, court places defendant under oath and defendant signs. MFAC granted, $50 per week beginning 9/16. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Order for Representation
Order for Contractual Income Witholding
t.t. CD @ SO
Letter from defendant to reset 7/19/22 court date.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture. Bond set 6-14-2022.

Called at 1:38 PM. Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Maurice S Talley not in court. Warrant to issue, bond forfeited. Minutes filed.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Maurice S Talley in court. Offer letter given to defendant. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Waiver of Right to Attorney

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Maurice S Talley in court. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Complaint read by court. Defendant would like to complete case very quickly. Defendant fills out waiver of right to attorney. Court has colloquy with defendant and finds the waiver to be voluntary. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Maurice S Talley in court, in custody by video. James Sempf for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman for bond purposes only. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Arrest
